SENT.plain: A 58-year-old woman suffered from mitral valve regurgitation with a giant thrombus in right atrium was thought to be complicated by anti-phospholipid syndrome (APS)
Positive anti-loops anti-coagulant and histories of cerebral infarction and miscarriage strongly indicated the diagnosis of APS
She underwent mitral valve replacement using bileaflet mechanical prosthetic value and removal of thrombus
She recovered uneventfully and strict anti-coagulation therapy has been continuing
